content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice problem. I succeed to solve it easily. The trick of the As being a A1234 and TJQKA straight turn the problem very interessant.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting and fun puzzle!

❌ Rejected the contribution.

Nice idea and awesome puzzle, but in my opinion it is too hard for a 15 Minute competition (other than python). 

I also don't understand why I have to iterate a second time over 0..n, I can do everything in the first loop? One could also require only one output per test, then one would not have to code / call a function within the loop.


Edit: Tested the challenge again, much better now --> approved :)
This Puzzle is really interresting but i taking a little more than 15min for solved it (with less trouble i think can do it in 15min)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I solved the puzzle myself and it took me just a bit over 5 minutes. I had some feedback on the wording of the description and the default code, which the contributor incorporated in the puzzle. It is a tricky but fun puzzle which I think is now ready to be played.

A little tricky for 15 min but doable. A few things that were confusing to me: 
- "A player's hand is the best 5 card-combination from the 7 card input." Given that a Full House or Quads are a better hand that a straight, the best 5 card-combination out of the 7 card input may not contain a straight, even if there is a 5 card-combination in the 7 cards that contains a straight. The test cases confirm that this is not how it's meant, though the description could be clearer. 
- In Python, the default code may be a bit misleading. "for hand in input.split()" should be "for card in input.split()". Also, I fail to imagine a good implementation that would use the second for-loop, so that might also be obsolete. 

Despite that, nicely done, it was a fun problem to solve!
The fact that A can be at both ends makes it a bit tricky, but I don't think it's too difficult. Should be doable in 15mins

Hello everyone,
thank you for taking the time to look at my contribution.
I'm leaving it as a WIP for the moment since I'm not sure if the difficulty is right for a CoC.
Please provide feedback if it is adequate or if I should cut back.

Thanks a lot!

Thank you very much for your feedback.
I changed the description to now read " player's hand is a 5 card-combination".
I like you suggestion and changed the default code. Sadly, I don't know if it is possible to only do one loop and had to stay with the two loops.

Thank you for your feedback.
You do not have to iterate a second time over n. Do you ask because of the generated stub for the puzzle? I was unable to get it to put the read input and write output in the same loop. If you let me know, how to do that, I will change it.
What would be your suggestions to make it easier to fit into the 15 minutes?

Hey Andreas,
I updated the contribution and made it easier.
The input  ist changed to only give the 5 cards that make up the hand. No longer does the program has to test 7 cards for all combinations.
 
Please check again if it now aligns better with your expectations.

Thanks a lot!
Hi, thanks for you work! The challenge is already approved, well done!
